   [**3-8**] Hep C/cirrhosis with recent open CCY complicated by VRE perihepatic
   fluid collection, admitted with lethargy, jaundice and abdominal pain.
   Found to have persistent perihepatic fluid collection in setting of
   medication noncompliance and not taking linezolid. Now, he has profound

   linezolid can also cause high lactate and may be a cause. CT shows C
   diff colitis and hepatic abscesses

   - Change propofol to versed and fentanyl bolus sedation as propofol can
   contribute to acidosis
   - Administer IV thiamine as beri beri can cause elevated lactate
   - Repeat ECHO as murmur is very prominent today to eval for interval
   change
   - change antibiotics to Daptomycin, IV flagyl, PO vancomycin and
   Meropenem
   - consider change linesozlid to daptomycin given thrombodytopenia and
   question of cause of lactate acidosis
   - trend lactate/ABG every 4 hours
   .
   # Altered Mental status: infection, hepatic enceph, uremia
   - on lactulose
   - will continue to address underlying causes
   .
   # Anemia/GIB. Baseline 27-30. No EGD reports in OMR, but per GI notes,
   EGD from [**2151**]8 did not show varices. Concern for GIB given sharp
   drop, eg. gastrophaty, vs. new varices. Patient with chronic anemia at
   baseline so hemolysis less concerning and most of bili is direct,
   however difficult to assess given liver failure. [**3-3**] AM has large
   volume lower GIB as noted in history.
   - transfuse HCT<25
   - Guiac all stools
   - IV PPI [**Hospital1 7**] for concerning bleed.
   - d/w GI for scope now that intubated
   - Q 4 hour HCT
   .
   # Thrombocytopenia: Liver dz vs meds (linezolid)
   - continue to trend
   - transfuse for plts<20 or bleeding
   .
   # elevated INR: may be from liver dz, DIC, received a total of 4 uPRBC,
   4 u FFP, cyroprecipate yesterday
   -Blood products as needed
   .
   # ARF. Cre 1.2 (baseline 0.8) Has been getting PRBCs and albumin today.
   Na < 10 in urine. Possibly pre-renal given suspected sepsis, but also
   pt. hyperdynamic on exam, and does not resond to fluids challenge, thus
   concern for hepatorenal. U/A unremarkable, has slight hydronephrosis on
   CT [**2-13**]. CT w/ mild hydronephrosis.

   - Consult renal regarding possible CVVH

   - Free Ca level-trending down

   - restart lactulose and rifaximin when able
   - Continue midodrine

   -          continue q 8 hour lytes
   .
